title_en: Collective bargaining: a warning strike has paralyzed the operation of a number of ports in northern Germany
summary_en:
Workers at the northern ports went on strike before the start of the third round of collective bargaining.
The warning strike caused damage to the port of Hamburg and the transshipment of containers.
The Verdi trade union has called on port workers in several cities to go on strike.
Verdi demands an increase in hourly wages and shift fees for employees.
The Central Association of German Port Companies has proposed a wage increase, but it does not meet the requirements of the trade union.
On Monday morning, many workers at the northern ports went on strike as a warning before the start of the third round of collective bargaining.
